title: Olympic Star Muyinga FC
text:
Olympic Star de Muyinga is a professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Muyinga">Muyinga</a>, <a href="Burundi">Burundi</a>. The team currently plays in the <a href="Burundi%20Premier%20League">Burundi Ligue A</a>, the top division of <a href="Football%20in%20Burundi">Burundi football</a>.
History.
It was founded in 1997 in the city of <a href="Muyinga">Muyinga</a> and played for the first time in the top-flight of the Burundian football in 2005, after the introduction of the sixteen-team format. A year earlier, she had created a sensation by reaching the final of the <a href="Burundian%20Cup">Coupe de l'Unité</a>, lost against <a href="Muzinga">Muzinga</a> (0–3).
Relegated at the end of the 2009 season, Olympic returned to the top tier, winning Group B of the Second Division in the 2013–14 season.
The club managed to win the <a href="Burundian%20Cup">Burundi Cup</a> in the 2016–17 season, beating <a href="Le%20Messager%20Ngozi%20FC">Le Messager Ngozi FC</a> in the final 2–1 in extra time, with a goal by Slim Saidi in the 98 minute. 
The first appearance in an international tournament was in the <a href="2018%20CAF%20Confederation%20Cup">2018 season of the CAF Confederation Cup</a>. There they faced in the preliminary round the <a href="Burkina%20Faso">Burkinabé</a> club <a href="%C3%89toile%20Filante%20de%20Ouagadougou">Étoile Filante</a>, and after a 0–0 draw in the 1st leg, they won 1–0 at <a href="Ouagadougou">Ouagadougou</a> in 2nd leg, qualifying in the first round where they were eliminated by <a href="El%20Hilal%20SC%20El%20Obeid">Al-Hilal Al-Ubayyid</a> from <a href="Sudan">Sudan</a>, 0–0 at <a href="Stade%20Urukundo%20de%20Buye">Urukundo Stadium</a> in <a href="Commune%20of%20Ngozi">Ngozi</a> and 0–6 at <a href="El%20Obeid">El Obeid</a>.
